page.title: 02Forestry
page.content: In our area there are four sets of different forestry groups.Buccluech Estates,Fountain Forestry,Economic Forestry,and, biggest of all, Forestry Commission.Buccluech Estates manages itsself,Fountain Forestry are a managing company and so are Economic Forestry and Forestry Commission who are the largest land owners in Britain and their forests in Nithsdale cover 18% of the land.In our area to plant one hectare of forest costs Â£1200. Foresters plant Sitka and Norway Spruce, Douglas and Silver Fir, Larch and Scots Pine which are all soft woods, also Beech, Ash, Oak, Rowan, Cherry and Birch which are all hard woods. Conifer trees are 45years when felled, the other trees are 35_60years old. All trees are about 30m high when felled.
